ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
ygData.msgSnippet: hehehe +2 to a resistance is meaningless ;)  The only time I worry about +resist on an item is if it s +5 or more.  And even then I will usually only worry
ygData.messageBody:
hehehe +2 to a resistance is meaningless ;) The only time I worry about
+resist on an item is if it's +5 or more. And even then I will usually only
worry about it if I'm planning to fight something that I need that
resistance for (VOX, Naggy etc). Other than that my resistance gear stays
in the bank. I've found that AC is more important, by far, than Resists
unless the resists are either AMAZING (+5 or more to all or +5 or more to
one for certain specific occasions)

Just my take though. I banked my lambent boots as soon as I got singing
steel. Pluss it's nice to be getting out of "All blue". I'm hoping to get
Mithril legs on my next FG run so that I can bank my greeves as well. I
doubt I'll ever get singing steel greaves considering who/what drops them
I'd love to have them even though their effect is silly.

Lyrnia
----- Original Message -----
From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 12:24 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions


> I wouldn't wear them because they are lacking the +2 to every resistance
> that my current lambent boots afford me.
>
> I believe in 2 things, ac and resistances. (with hp almost being a 3rd)
All
> of my equipment is focused towards increasing those 2 things. The +7 ac is
> not enough to out weigh +10 vs resistances (added up). Granted, this
> attitude may change if I ever own a pair of singing steel boots. = )
>
> Draelon
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 12:18 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
>
>
> Uhh forgive my ignorance...
>
> Why wouldn't you wear them? They're AC 18!?!? I wear mine now, even with
> the silly 1 water proc. My lambent boots are far lower in AC than the
> singing steel... can you explain why you wouldn't wear the steel?
>
> Just curious.
>
> Lyrnia
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Greg Gillan" <ggillan@...>
> To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 11:08 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
>
>
> > Even if the boots summoned 20 water at once like the level 24 mage
spell,
> > I'd find them more useful. Mind you, they'd still stay in my backpack
and
> > only come out when I'm thirsty.
> > I just cant be bothered to click on the damn things 20 times to get a
> usable
> > amount of water. I don't know any caster that bothers to use their
single
> > food/drink summoning spells, its just too much trouble. Its not exactly
> > hard or expensive to buy a large supply of food/drink and carry it with
> you.
> >
> >
> > Elwyn <Da`Kor>
> > 53 Minstrel of Erollisi Marr
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> > Sent: Friday, May 19, 2000 9:24 AM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] GZ answers some bard questions
> >
> >
> > Everyone keeps complaining about the effects on our new armor, myself
> > included. (Don't get me wrong I LOVE enduring breath on the gloves!!!!
> > Anyone who doesn't is silly)
> >
> > But nobody has suggested alternatives. I would love to see ideas on
> things
> > we could get (be realistic) that we can't already do with songs that we
> use
> > relatively regularly.
> >
> > Lyrnia Jongleur
